display_notes: We use the IMFÃs fossil fuel subsidies database (2021) to estimate the avoided congestion and crash cost on roads. These costs are provided per litre of fuel and reflect external costs. We use average costs across LAC and calculate total crash costs assuming external crash costs are 75% of the total (Parry et al., 2014). We assume gasoline externalities apply to biofuels and we apply costs to electric vehicles by calculating the cost per unit of energy, adjusting for approximately 4x higher energy efficiency of EVs.
